alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River; Inland Indian River (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 9:42AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Indian River County through 1015 AM EDT... At 942 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Indian River Shores, moving northwest at 35 mph. This storm has exhibited weak rotation over the local coastal waters. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sebastian, Vero Beach, Fellsmere, Indian River Shores and Gifford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Indian River; Inland Indian River
